intro: Cephalaria elata, commonly known as the tall cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Cephalaria elata is often found in meadows and along riverbanks, where it thrives in sunny to partially shaded conditions.
